title: THE SECRET TO PLANTING GARLIC FOR PROFIT (AND SAVING YOUR SEED)

tasks.task: Farming tasks related to growing garlic commercially.
subtasks: Saving seed stock by multiplying cloves year after year.
Choosing the right planting date (December 20th in author's climate).
Preparing the soil with compost and mulch (composted manure and wood chips).
Breaking bulbs into individual cloves and soaking them in vodka.
Mixing compost tea with mycorrhizal inoculants for garlic cloves.
Planting cloves at the appropriate depth and spacing in prepared beds.
Protecting garlic from pests with insect netting and cultural practices.
Removing scapes to maximize bulb size.
Monitoring bulbs for harvest readiness (when bottom leaves turn brown).
Harvesting garlic by pulling bulbs from the compost mulch.
Drying and curing garlic indoors to avoid mold, using a dehumidifier and ventilation.
Storage of cured garlic in mesh bags at optimal humidity.
